snippet: Gunmen disguised as police SWAT teams entered the town of Haditha, killing three police officers at their homes and more in clashes at checkpoints, security officials said.
abstract: At least 20 police officers are killed in Haditha in western Iraq by dozens of gunmen masquerading as black-clad SWAT teams out to make a high-level arrest; attack is the latest in a long militant campaign to infiltrate, undercut and batter Iraq's military and police forces.

byline.contributor: Yasir Ghazi contributed reporting from Baghdad, and Iraqi employees of The New York Times from Anbar Province.

lead_paragraph: Gunmen disguised as police SWAT teams entered the town of Haditha, killing three police officers at their homes and more in clashes at checkpoints, security officials said.

headline.seo: 20 Police Officers Killed in Western Iraq
headline.main: Gunmen in Uniforms Kill 20 Police Officers in Iraq
headline.print_headline: Gunmen in Uniforms Kill 20 Police Officers in Iraq
